subject: Newbie question on multiple @Test decorations
msgSnippet: Good day.  I am new to JUnit annotations. I have a need to execute a set of classic account registration tests: register a user by [email, password], verify
messageBody:
Good day. I am new to JUnit annotations.

I have a need to execute a set of classic account registration tests:
register a user by [email, password], verify that that succeeds, then
immediately follow this with an identical registration with the same
[email, password], which should fail because the account already
exists. This is a specific case of a more general scenario where the
first test develops state the second test needs to know about.

It occurred to me to use a single test class, containing two @Test-
decorated methods: register() and dupRegister(). The problem with
this structure is that I found no documentation that indicates that
the first decorated test method is executed after the second decorated
test method. I also considered using the Parameter annotation, with
duplicate [email, password] provided as the parameter list. While
that could drive the tests, I see no way of indicating in this scheme
that the first test invocation should succeed, while the second should
fail.

Would someone be kind enough to sketch a reasonable, "JUnit way" to
approach this.

Thanks.
